title.narrative: Ramaad - environment relief project in Somalia

description.narrative: The key development problem is desertification leading to loss of livelihoods poverty and forced migration. The development goal is sustainable use of natural resources and secured livelihood in the project areas. The project started in 2014 and is planned for 10 years. This is its 3rd phase. The outcomes are:1. Pressure on natural vegetation reduced2. Environmental expertise at different levels of administration has increased and environmental policy processes enhancedThe principal activities include- awar eness raising programs media campaigns school visits- workshops on energy saving stove making and usage- trainings for charcoal producers on sustainable production- expansion of tree nurseries advanced trainings on nursery techniques indigenous tree seed c ollection- promotion of agro-forestry practices- joint meetings for project partners and stakeholders workshops with authoritiesThe project addresses several human rights especially actively enhances everybody?s right to a standard of living adequate for w ell-being. Even though the environment doesn?t fit neatly into any category of human rights it is considered as a pre-requisite for the enjoyment of human rights. The project promotes gender equality by enabling the participation of women in trainings and activities. The poorest people feel the negative impacts of the climate change most severely. By finding sustainable solutions to the environment problems and by helping people to adapt to the climate change the project reduces inequality.The project is im plemented at 3 sites in southern and central Somalia with the FSN's 4 partners in Finland and 3 partner NGOs in Somalia. The innovative cooperative model enforces the civil society in Somalia and creates new networks promoting in that way also peace and st ability.The beneficiaries include families farmers and women charcoal producers and traders regional administrations students teachers and volunteers. The final beneficiaries are the local communities at large (estimated population 230 000) that benefit fr om the better condition of the environment which will improve their livelihood in general.
